info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 7:46PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Franklin, northwestern Elbert and southwestern Hart Counties through 815 PM EDT... At 746 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles southwest of Hartwell, or 4 miles north of Bowman, moving northwest at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hartwell, Royston, Bowman, Canon, Franklin Springs, Victoria Bryant State Park, Bowersville, Nuberg, Vanna and Dewy Rose. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
